discussion_comments.comment_body:
Do we really need to add this new Dockerfile? Is it actually going to run in CI?

If we do want this, we also need to make sure this Go version gets updated with the rest of the automatic Go version updates or otherwise it will very quickly go stale. Adding new jobs is not without overhead and we should be conscious about and make sure they implement all necessary things to maintain it as well.

discussion_comments.comment_body: CI will run in linux, so I suppose this isn't actually necessary, removed

FYI, the `vitess/bootstrap` Docker image is only used by two of our CI actions:
- https://github.com/vitessio/vitess/blob/main/.github/workflows/java_docker_test.yml
- https://github.com/vitessio/vitess/blob/main/.github/workflows/docker_test_cluster.yml
I can remove this part if you think it's unnecessary

We usually modify bootstrap version increment (`BOOTSTRAP_VERSION` in the Makefile, and other places) by 1 major version on `main` when we modify something in this image configuration. Since we are only adding a new image and not modifying existing ones, _I think_ it would be fine to not bump the version in this PR. However, we should document the last entry in `CHANGELOG.md` of this folder to document the addition of 84.

> I can remove this part if you think it's unnecessary

I think it is good to still have it, in the future we may want to use 84 as the default in our tests.
